metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（混合林站叶面积指数-2019）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the LAI measurements from the Sidaoqiao in the downstream of the Heihe integrated observatory network from June 1 to September 20 in 2019. The site was located in Ejina Banner in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The elevation is 870 m. There are 1 observation samples, around Mixed forest station (101.1335E, 41.9903N), which is about 30 m×30 m in size. Five sub-canopy nodes and one above-canopy node are arranged in each sample. 
The data is obtained from LAINet measurements; the four-steps are performed to obtain LAI: the raw data is light quantum (level 0); the daily LAI can be obtained using the software LAInet (level 1); further the invalid and null values are screened and using the 7 days moving averaged method to obtain the processed LAI (level 2); for the multi LAINet nodes observation, the averaged LAI of the nodes area is the final LAI (level 3).
The released data are the post processed LAI products and stored using *.xls format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Qu et al. (2014) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2019年6月1日至2019年9月20日的黑河水文气象观测网下游混合林站叶面积指数观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗四道桥，海拔870 m，下垫面是胡杨与柽柳混合。观测在混合林站（101.1335E, 41.9903N）旁开展，样方大小约30m×30m，每个样方内布设5个冠层下节点和1个冠层上节点。
本数据集由叶面积指数无线传感网（LAINet）获取，该仪器原始观测数据为仪器自动获取的每个节点逐日逐小时的光照数据（Level0），利用LAINet软件对原始观测数据进行处理，逐节点计算每天LAI（Level1），进一步对无效值识别与填充，并7天滑动平均消除天气变化对LAI计算的影响（Level2），对有多个LAINet节点的观测子区，节点的均值为该子区的最终观测值（Level3）。
本次发布的数据集为处理后的Level3产品，数据以*.xls格式存储。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Qu et al. (2014)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Verification.QuestionEn: Are long-term observations considered indispensable for achieving a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Verification.QuestionCn: 长期观测被认为是实现对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解不可或缺的。

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the most applicable data collection method for monitoring oasis–desert systems based on eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, or automatic weather stations?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 监测绿洲-沙漠系统的最适用数据收集方法是基于涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪还是自动气象站？
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统和闪烁仪

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Which data processing approach is more suitable for handling oasis–desert observational datasets: data collection and archiving, quality control procedures, or data sharing protocols?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 哪种数据处理方法更适合处理绿洲-沙漠观测数据集：数据收集与归档、质量控制程序，还是数据共享协议？

Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域的混交林站点中，收集叶面积指数信息使用了什么数据收集方法？

Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 自动气象站通常在何时记录水文气象数据，包括辐射和土壤热通量等参数？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to monitor leaf area index in arid and semi-arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于监测干旱和半干旱地区叶面积指数的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method used to monitor leaf area index in arid and semi-arid regions is the wireless sensor network called LAINet, which automatically collects hourly light data from multiple nodes within a study area. This data is processed to calculate daily leaf area index values, with invalid values identified and filled, and a 7-day moving average applied to reduce the impact of weather changes.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种用于监测干旱和半干旱地区叶面积指数的数据收集方法是无线传感器网络LAI网，它自动从研究区域内的多个节点收集每小时的光数据。这些数据经过处理以计算每日叶面积指数值，识别并填补无效值，并应用7天移动平均以减少天气变化的影响。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in data collection for ecosystem monitoring in inland river basins in arid and semi-arid areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域生态系统监测中，数据收集面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge faced in data collection for ecosystem monitoring in inland river basins in arid and semi-arid areas includes the ecological environment degradation issues such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent occurrence of dust storms, as observed in basins like the Tarim River basin, Aral Sea basin, and Lake Urmia basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域生态系统监测的数据收集中面临的挑战包括生态环境退化问题，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁发生的沙尘暴，这些问题在塔里木河流域、咸海流域和乌尔米湖流域中得到了体现。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that includes energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测的示例数据集？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset that includes energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas is the dataset from the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin, which includes data from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations. This dataset, available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center, comprises energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological data, and vegetation and soil parameters.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个包含绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测的示例数据集是来自黑河流域中下游的数据集，该数据集包括来自11个地表通量和气象站的数据。该数据集可从国家西藏 Plateau 数据中心获取，包含能量、水汽和碳通量、气象水文数据以及植被和土壤参数。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the specific characteristics of the LAINet used for collecting leaf area index data in mixed forest stations?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: LAINet用于在混合森林站点收集叶面积指数数据的具体特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: wireless sensor network, collects light data hourly, canopy under nodes, canopy top nodes, daily data processing, calculates leaf area index, identifies and fills invalid values, applies 7-day moving average
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 无线传感器网络，每小时收集光数据，节点在树冠下，树冠顶部节点，每日数据处理，计算叶面积指数，识别并填充无效值，应用7天移动平均。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What features define the data processing levels for leaf area index data in mixed forest environments?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在混合森林环境中，叶面积指数数据的数据处理级别的特征包括哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: Level0 raw hourly light data, Level1 daily LAI for each node, Level2 identification and filling of invalid values, 7-day moving average, Level3 final averaged observation value for sub-areas with multiple nodes
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: Level0 原始每小时光照数据，Level1 每个节点的每日LAI，Level2 识别和填充无效值，7天移动平均，Level3 对具有多个节点的子区域的最终平均观测值。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the defining characteristics of the observational datasets collected in oasis–desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集的观测数据集的定义特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term observations, energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, methane fluxes, hydrometeorology data, vegetation parameters, soil parameters, high-resolution data, half-hourly fluxes, 10-minute averages of meteorological parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 长期观测、能量通量、水汽通量、碳通量、甲烷通量、水文气象数据、植被参数、土壤参数、高分辨率数据、半小时通量、气象参数的10分钟平均值。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many nodes are utilized in the LAINet for canopy observations in each sample plot within the mixed forest station?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在混合森林站的每个样本地块中，LAINet用于冠层观测的节点数量是多少？
Quantification.AnswerEn: 5 canopy under nodes, 1 canopy above node
Quantification.AnswerCn: 5个冠层在节点下方，1个冠层在节点上方。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in the middle and lower reaches of the HRB since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在HRB的中下游地区建立了多少个地表通量和气象站？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'eddy covariance system' mean in the context of data collection methods for oasis-desert systems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的数据收集方法中，“涡度协方差系统”指的是一种用于测量气体交换（如二氧化碳和水蒸气）的方法，通过分析气流的涡度和浓度变化来评估生态系统的碳和水循环。
Definition.AnswerEn: An eddy covariance system is a method used to measure and calculate turbulent fluxes of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane in an ecosystem. It involves half-hourly data acquisition to analyze the exchange of these gases and energy between the land surface and atmosphere, providing insights into oasis-desert interactions.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统是一种用于测量和计算生态系统中能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷的湍流通量的方法。它涉及每半小时的数据采集，以分析这些气体和能量在地表与大气之间的交换，提供对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的洞察。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'oasis–desert systems' in environmental research?
Definition.QuestionCn: “绿洲-沙漠系统”在环境研究中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Oasis–desert systems are significant in environmental research because they play a crucial role in maintaining ecological stability and agricultural productivity in arid and semi-arid regions, which support a large proportion of the population. Understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange within these systems is critical for achieving sustainable development and carbon neutrality goals.
Definition.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统在环境研究中具有重要意义，因为它们在维持干旱和半干旱地区的生态稳定性和农业生产力方面发挥着关键作用，这些地区支持着大量人口。理解这些系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换对于实现可持续发展和碳中和目标至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for leaf area index using LAINet compare to the eddy covariance system and scintillometer in capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用LAINet测量叶面积指数的数据收集方法与涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪在捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳通量方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: LAINet focuses on capturing leaf area index through wireless sensor networks that process light data at canopy levels, while the eddy covariance system and scintillometer are used to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data, including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, for long-term ecosystem monitoring in oasis-desert systems.
Comparison.AnswerCn: LAINet专注于通过无线传感器网络捕捉叶面积指数，这些网络在冠层水平处理光数据，而涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪用于获取半小时的湍流通量数据，包括能量、水蒸气和碳通量，以便在绿洲-沙漠系统中进行长期生态系统监测。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges faced by inland river basins in arid regions affect the data collection and dataset development for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange compared to leaf area index monitoring?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱地区面临的挑战如何影响能源、水汽和碳交换的数据收集和数据集开发，与叶面积指数监测相比有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Inland river basins face ecological degradation challenges like river drying and land desertification, which impact the continuity and accuracy of datasets for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, necessitating robust long-term monitoring, whereas leaf area index monitoring using LAINet may be less directly influenced but still requires careful handling of environmental variability.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临生态退化的挑战，如河流干涸和土地沙漠化，这影响了能源、水汽和碳交换数据集的连续性和准确性，因此需要进行强有力的长期监测。而使用LAINet进行叶面积指数监测可能受到的直接影响较小，但仍需谨慎处理环境变异性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the use of wireless sensor networks for leaf area index measurement improve the understanding of ecosystem dynamics in mixed forest environments?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 无线传感器网络用于叶面积指数测量如何改善对混合森林环境生态系统动态的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of wireless sensor networks, such as LAINet, allows for continuous, automated collection of light data at multiple nodes, which can then be processed to calculate daily leaf area index values. This method helps in capturing temporal variations and the spatial heterogeneity of leaf area index, offering insights into the ecosystem dynamics of mixed forests, such as those with poplar and tamarisk species.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 无线传感器网络的使用，例如LAINet，允许在多个节点上持续、自动地收集光数据，这些数据可以被处理以计算每日叶面积指数值。这种方法有助于捕捉叶面积指数的时间变化和空间异质性，为混合森林（如杨树和盐碱树物种的森林）的生态系统动态提供了洞察。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in maintaining the accuracy and reliability of long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange datasets in arid and semi-arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，维护长期能源、水汽和碳交换数据集的准确性和可靠性可能会面临哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining the accuracy and reliability of such datasets may include ecological environment degradation, such as drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and dust storms. These factors can affect the data collection infrastructure and introduce variability in the measurements, necessitating robust data processing and quality control procedures to ensure data integrity.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 维护此类数据集的准确性和可靠性面临的挑战可能包括生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴。这些因素可能会影响数据收集基础设施，并引入测量的变异性，因此需要强有力的数据处理和质量控制程序以确保数据的完整性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can the findings from oasis–desert systems research influence sustainable development strategies in arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统研究的发现可以通过哪些方式影响干旱地区的可持续发展战略？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Findings from oasis–desert systems research can inform sustainable development strategies by providing a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. This knowledge helps maintain ecological stability and supports the socioeconomic development of oases, which is critical for achieving carbon neutrality and ecological security in arid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统研究的发现可以通过提供能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解来为可持续发展战略提供信息。这些知识有助于维持生态稳定，并支持绿洲的社会经济发展，这对实现碳中和和干旱地区的生态安全至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the need for processing raw light data into daily LAI values in the context of mixed forest stations?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在混合森林站的背景下，处理原始光数据以生成每日LAI值的需求是什么原因？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The raw light data is processed into daily LAI values to account for variations in daily light conditions and to ensure accurate measurements by using LAINet software, which helps in recognizing and filling invalid values and applying a 7-day moving average to mitigate weather-related fluctuations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 原始光照数据经过处理，转化为每日的叶面积指数（LAI）值，以考虑每日光照条件的变化并确保测量的准确性。使用LAINet软件可以识别和填补无效值，并应用7天移动平均法，以减轻天气相关的波动。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it important to understand the exchange of energy, water vapor, and carbon in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳的交换是重要的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Understanding these exchanges is crucial for maintaining ecological stability and socio-economic development, as well as achieving carbon peaking and neutrality in these regions. It is essential for recognizing interactions between oasis and desert systems, which support the sustainable development of oases.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 理解这些交换对于维持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要，同时也是实现这些地区碳达峰和碳中和的关键。认识到绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用，对于支持绿洲的可持续发展至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the degradation of the ecological environment in inland river basins located in arid and semiarid areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域生态环境退化的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Factors include the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, which are particularly prevalent in many inland river basins along the Silk Road, impacting ecological stability.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 因素包括河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化、土地沙漠化的加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，这些现象在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域尤为明显，影响了生态稳定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of utilizing long-term observational datasets from oasis–desert ecosystems on understanding carbon exchange patterns?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用来自绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观测数据集对理解碳交换模式的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing long-term observational datasets from oasis–desert ecosystems can significantly enhance the understanding of carbon exchange patterns by providing quantitative insights into how these ecosystems function as carbon sinks. This understanding is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and protecting ecological stability, which is significant for supporting the ecological security and sustainable development of these areas.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用来自绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观测数据集，可以显著增强对碳交换模式的理解，提供关于这些生态系统作为碳汇功能的定量见解。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用和保护生态稳定性至关重要，这对支持这些地区的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How could the integration of multiple LAINet nodes' data impact the accuracy and reliability of leaf area index measurements in mixed forest stands?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多个LAINet节点数据的整合如何影响混合森林林分中叶面积指数测量的准确性和可靠性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating data from multiple LAINet nodes can enhance the accuracy and reliability of leaf area index measurements by averaging the nodes' observations to obtain a more comprehensive and representative value for the sub-area. This process helps in filling invalid values and smoothing out short-term weather fluctuations, thus producing a more robust dataset for ecological analysis.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合来自多个LAINet节点的数据可以通过对节点观测值进行平均，增强叶面积指数测量的准确性和可靠性，从而获得更全面和具有代表性的子区域值。这个过程有助于填补无效值并平滑短期天气波动，从而为生态分析提供更稳健的数据集。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What outcomes might arise from addressing the ecological degradation challenges in inland river basins with the help of datasets that include hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 通过利用包括水文气象、植被和土壤参数的数据集来解决内陆河流域的生态退化挑战，可能会产生以下结果：
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Addressing ecological degradation challenges in inland river basins using comprehensive datasets that include hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters could lead to improved strategies for maintaining ecological balance. It may help in developing sustainable management practices, preserving natural vegetation, and mitigating the impacts of desertification and dust storms, thereby ensuring long-term ecological and socioeconomic benefits for the affected regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用包括水文气象、植被和土壤参数在内的综合数据集来应对内陆河流域的生态退化挑战，可以改善维持生态平衡的策略。这有助于制定可持续管理实践，保护自然植被，减轻沙漠化和沙尘暴的影响，从而确保受影响地区的长期生态和社会经济利益。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems for sustainable development?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换对于可持续发展至关重要。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary objectives of collecting long-term observational datasets in oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集长期观测数据集的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objectives are to achieve a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, recognize the oasis–desert interactions, and protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是实现对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，识别绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用，并保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in arid and semiarid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance is critical to ensure the ecological security and sustainable development of oases, which are vital for supporting the majority of the population in arid regions and play a crucial role in the carbon balance and global carbon cycle.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维持平衡对于确保绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展至关重要，绿洲对支持干旱地区大多数人口至关重要，并在碳平衡和全球碳循环中发挥着关键作用。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are employed to ensure the accuracy and reliability of leaf area index measurements in mixed forest stations using wireless sensor networks?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在混合森林站点中，确保叶面积指数测量的准确性和可靠性所采用的方法包括使用无线传感器网络。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The leaf area index measurements in mixed forest stations are obtained using the LAINet wireless sensor network, which captures light data hourly at each node. The raw data undergoes processing with LAINet software to calculate daily LAI values, followed by invalid value identification and imputation. A 7-day moving average is applied to mitigate weather-induced variability, and the average of multiple nodes in an observation sub-area is used as the final observation value.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 混合森林站的叶面积指数测量是通过LAINet无线传感器网络获得的，该网络每小时在每个节点捕获光数据。原始数据经过LAINet软件处理，以计算每日LAI值，随后进行无效值识别和插补。应用7天移动平均以减轻天气引起的变异性，并使用观察子区域内多个节点的平均值作为最终观测值。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are involved in establishing and maintaining long-term observational datasets in arid and semiarid river basins, and how are these datasets made accessible for research purposes?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱河流流域建立和维护长期观测数据集涉及哪些程序步骤，以及这些数据集如何为研究目的提供访问？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets in arid and semiarid river basins are established by setting up land surface flux and meteorological stations. These datasets include energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, along with hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters. The data are collected, processed, and subjected to quality control, then archived and made freely available for research purposes through platforms like the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱河流流域，长期观测数据集通过建立地表通量和气象站来建立。这些数据集包括能量、水汽和碳通量，以及水文气象、植被和土壤参数。数据经过收集、处理和质量控制后，归档并通过国家西藏高原数据中心等平台免费提供给研究使用。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the continuous monitoring of leaf area index in mixed forest stations in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在干旱地区的混合森林站点能够持续监测叶面积指数？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of a wireless sensor network known as LAINet allows for the continuous acquisition of light data at each node, which is then processed to calculate daily leaf area index values. This technological setup facilitates the continuous monitoring of leaf area index in mixed forest stations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 一种名为LAINet的无线传感器网络可以在每个节点上持续获取光数据，然后处理这些数据以计算每日的叶面积指数值。这种技术设置使得在混合森林站点中能够持续监测叶面积指数。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do data processing techniques enable the identification and filling of invalid values in environmental datasets?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 数据处理技术如何使识别和填充环境数据集中的无效值成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data processing techniques involve utilizing LAINet software to process raw observation data, calculate daily leaf area index, and identify and fill invalid values. The process also includes a 7-day moving average to mitigate the impact of weather variations on LAI calculation.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理技术涉及利用LAINet软件处理原始观测数据，计算每日叶面积指数，并识别和填充无效值。该过程还包括7天移动平均，以减轻天气变化对LAI计算的影响。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways do long-term observational datasets enhance the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集在增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的理解方面有哪些作用？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems provide crucial data on energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with auxiliary hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters. These datasets are indispensable for quantitatively understanding the interactions and ensuring ecological stability in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的长期观测数据集提供了关于能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的重要数据，以及辅助的水文气象、植被和土壤参数。这些数据集对于定量理解绿洲–沙漠生态系统中的相互作用和确保生态稳定性至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it expected that maintaining a balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial for achieving sustainable oasis development?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 维护绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡被认为对实现可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。
Expectation.AnswerEn: It is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems to achieve sustainable oasis development because understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these ecosystems supports ecological security and sustainable development. This balance is significant for achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 维护绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展至关重要，因为理解这些生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换有助于生态安全和可持续发展。这种平衡对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和具有重要意义。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges are anticipated in collecting long-term observational datasets in arid and semiarid inland river basins?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域收集长期观测数据集时，预计会面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face challenges such as ecological environment degradation, including the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These factors make long-term data collection challenging.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临着生态环境恶化的挑战，包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些因素使得长期数据收集变得困难。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to utilize a combination of data collection methods involving both artificial and natural systems for understanding oasis–desert interactions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么有必要利用结合人工和自然系统的数据收集方法来理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用？
Expectation.AnswerEn: A combination of data collection methods from artificial and natural systems is necessary to achieve a comprehensive understanding of oasis–desert interactions because they provide long-term data on energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, which are crucial for recognizing these interactions and ensuring ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 为了全面理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，结合人工和自然系统的数据收集方法是必要的，因为它们提供了关于能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的长期数据，以及水文气象、植被和土壤参数，这些对于识别这些相互作用以及确保绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective do you believe the LAINet system is in capturing accurate leaf area index data in mixed forest environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您认为LAINet系统在混合森林环境中捕捉准确的叶面积指数数据的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The LAINet system is designed to automatically acquire light data across multiple nodes to calculate daily leaf area index values. The system further processes this data to remove invalid values and averages results across nodes to provide a comprehensive observation, suggesting a robust approach to capturing accurate data in mixed forest environments.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: LAINet系统旨在自动获取多个节点的光数据，以计算每日叶面积指数值。该系统进一步处理这些数据，以去除无效值，并在节点之间平均结果，以提供全面的观察，表明在混合森林环境中捕获准确数据的稳健方法。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the challenges faced in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在可持续发展中维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡所面临的挑战的评估是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems presents significant challenges due to ecological environment degradation issues such as drying rivers, vegetation degradation, and increased desertification, especially in inland river basins along the Silk Road. Long-term and comprehensive observational datasets are critical to address these challenges and support sustainable development.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡面临着重大挑战，主要由于生态环境退化问题，如河流干涸、植被退化和沙漠化加剧，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的内陆河流流域。长期和全面的观测数据集对于应对这些挑战并支持可持续发展至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, how comprehensive are the observational datasets available from oasis–desert systems for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在我看来，来自绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集在理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换方面的全面性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The observational datasets from oasis–desert systems are quite comprehensive, comprising long-term data on energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. These datasets are collected using advanced methods like eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, which provide valuable insights into ecosystem interactions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集非常全面，包括关于能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的长期数据，以及关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。这些数据集采用先进的方法收集，如涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，为生态系统相互作用提供了宝贵的见解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods can effectively measure the energy and water vapor exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何有效测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量和水汽交换。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data collection involves using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data, as well as automatic weather stations that provide hydrometeorological data at a 10-minute average period. These methods enable detailed and accurate monitoring of energy and water vapor exchanges in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据，以及提供10分钟平均周期的自动气象站的水文气象数据。这些方法能够详细而准确地监测绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量和水蒸气交换。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data collection techniques utilized for monitoring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结用于监测绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques involve using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data. Additionally, hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles, are observed from automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period. Groundwater table data and auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters are also part of the data collection.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集技术包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据。此外，还通过自动气象站观察水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面，平均周期为10分钟。地下水位数据和涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据也是数据收集的一部分。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify the challenges faced in data collection for ecological studies in inland river basins within arid and semi-arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别在干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域生态研究中数据收集面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The challenges in data collection for ecological studies in these regions include the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent occurrences of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在这些地区进行生态研究的数据收集面临的挑战包括生态环境退化危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路向西延伸的许多内陆河流流域。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe potential datasets that could be utilized for studying land surface flux and meteorological conditions in arid regions of western China.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述可以用于研究中国西部干旱地区地表通量和气象条件的潜在数据集。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include the observational data from the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, which consist of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations, along with hydrometeorological data and vegetation and soil parameters. These datasets are freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center, with data collected from 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations established since 2012.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括来自HRB中下游的观测数据，这些数据包括能量、水汽和碳交换观测，以及水文气象数据和植被与土壤参数。这些数据集可以从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取，数据来自自2012年以来建立的11个陆面通量和气象站。
